testcase.name: testMove

failure.message:
org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: didPass was false Hint: When moving the snake is extended from the head in the current direction (and he snake is shortened from the tail if it is not currently growing). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is what went wrong:
step=0, rand=3, actions=<> Want | Got ✓ --------------- OO>... | OO>... A..... | A.....
step=1, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- .OO>.. | .O.>.. A..... | A.....
step=2, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- ..OO>. | ....>. A..... | A.....

testcase.name: testChangeDirs

failure.message:
org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: didPass was false Hint: You can change direction. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is what went wrong:
step=0, rand=2, actions=<> Want | Got ✓ ------------ OO>. | OO>. .A.. | .A.. .... | .... .... | ....
step=1, rand=2, actions=<ChangeDir(South()), Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------ .OO. | .O.. .Av. | .Av. .... | .... .... | ....
step=2, rand=2, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------ ..O. | .... .AO. | .A.. ..v. | ..v. .... | ....
step=3, rand=2, actions=<ChangeDir(West()), Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- .... | testcase.name: testIgnoreEatHead

failure.message:
org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: didPass was false Hint: It should not be possible to “crash into yourself”: If the snake is currently traveling eastwards, it should not be possible to change the current direction to west (and then die in the next step). This generalizes to other directions. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is what went wrong:
step=0, rand=5, actions=<> Want | Got ✓ --------------- OO>... | OO>... ..A... | ..A...
step=1, rand=5, actions=<ChangeDir(West()), Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- .OO>.. | .O.>.. ..A... | ..A...
step=2, rand=5, actions=<ChangeDir(West()), Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- ..OO>. | ....>. ..A... | ..A...

testcase.name: testQuickSwitch

failure.message:
org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: didPass was false Hint: It should not be possible to crash into yourself by changing the direction multiple times before the next step. For example, if the snake came from the west, and the we changed the current direction to north, it still should not be possible to change the direction to to west before taking a step. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is what went wrong:
step=0, rand=4, actions=<> Want | Got ✓ ------------ OO>. | OO>. ...A | ...A .... | ....
step=1, rand=4, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------ .OO> | .O.> ...A | ...A .... | ....
step=2, rand=4, actions=<ChangeDir(North()), ChangeDir(West()), Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------ ..OO | .... ...A | ...A ...^ | ...^

testcase.name: testQuickSwitch2

failure.message:
org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: didPass was false Hint: To prevent crashing into yourself, you should not just pick the first change of direction.Instead, you should take the last valid change of direction (i.e. not a change in the direction wherethe snake came from -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is what went wrong:
step=0, rand=4, actions=<> Want | Got ✓ ------------ OO>. | OO>. ...A | ...A .... | ....
step=1, rand=4, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------ .OO> | .O.> ...A | ...A .... | ....
step=2, rand=4, actions=<ChangeDir(West()), ChangeDir(North()), Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------ ..OO | .... ...A | ...A ...^ | ...^

step=0, rand=4, actions=<> Want | Got ✓ ------------ OO>. | OO>. ...A | ...A .... | ....
